slides.title: Introduction to ICDS
slides.content:
**Integrated Child Development Services (ICDS)**

This is the MOST IMPORTANT chapter for Anganwadi workers!

**What is ICDS?**
- World's largest outreach program for children
- Launched in 1975
- Operates through Anganwadi Centres
- Ministry of Women and Child Development

**Target Beneficiaries:**
- Children 0-6 years
- Pregnant women
- Lactating mothers

**Your Workplace:** You work as part of the ICDS program!

**This chapter covers:**
- ICDS services
- Role of Anganwadi workers
- Related government schemes

slides.title: Six Services of ICDS
slides.content:
**The 6 Key Services Provided by ICDS**

**1. Supplementary Nutrition:**
- Hot cooked meals for children 3-6 years
- Take-home ration for 6 months-3 years
- Nutrition for pregnant/lactating women

**2. Immunization:**
- Full immunization for all children
- Coordination with ANM
- Tracking and mobilization

**3. Health Check-ups:**
- Regular weight/height monitoring
- Growth chart maintenance
- Referral services

**4. Referral Services:**
- Link with health facilities
- Coordination with ASHA/ANM
- Follow-up of referred cases

**5. Preschool Education:**
- Early learning activities
- School readiness
- Age-appropriate play and learning

**6. Nutrition and Health Education:**
- Counseling to mothers
- Community awareness
- Demonstration of good practices

slides.title: Anganwadi Centre - Structure
slides.content:
**The Anganwadi Centre**

**What is an Anganwadi?**
- Courtyard shelter
- Community-based center
- Serves 40-80 children (depending on population)

**Anganwadi Team:**

**1. Anganwadi Worker (AWW) - YOU!**
- Main functionary
- Runs the center
- Implements all 6 ICDS services
- Honorarium-based position

**2. Anganwadi Helper (AWH):**
- Assists AWW
- Cooking, cleaning
- Helps with children

**Supervision:**
- **Supervisor (CDPO Office):**
  - Supervises 20-25 Anganwadis
  - Provides guidance and support
- **CDPO (Child Development Project Officer):**
  - Head of project office
  - Administrative and technical support

**Infrastructure:**
- Safe building
- Kitchen facility
- Toilet
- Clean drinking water
- Play materials and learning aids

slides.title: Role and Responsibilities of AWW
slides.content:
**Your Role as Anganwadi Worker**

**Daily Tasks:**
- Open Anganwadi center on time
- Conduct preschool activities
- Prepare/serve supplementary nutrition
- Monitor attendance
- Maintain hygiene and cleanliness

**Health and Nutrition:**
- Monthly weighing of children
- Plot growth charts
- Identify malnutrition
- Mobilize for immunization
- Health and nutrition counseling

**Survey and Registration:**
- Conduct household survey
- Register beneficiaries (0-6 children, pregnant/lactating women)
- Update registers monthly
- Track new beneficiaries

**Home Visits:**
- Visit pregnant women and newborns
- Counsel mothers
- Follow-up of absent children
- Track malnourished children

**Record Keeping:**
- Attendance register
- Stock register
- Immunization tracking
- Monthly progress reports
- Growth monitoring charts

**Community Mobilization:**
- Mothers' meetings
- Village health and nutrition days
- Awareness campaigns

slides.title: Poshan Abhiyaan (National Nutrition Mission)
slides.content:
**National Nutrition Mission - Poshan Abhiyaan**

**Launched:** March 2018
**Goal:** Reduce malnutrition in India

**Targets (by 2022):**
- Reduce stunting by 6%
- Reduce undernutrition by 6%
- Reduce anemia by 9%
- Reduce low birth weight by 6%

**Key Strategies:**

**1. Jan Andolan (People's Movement):**
- Community participation
- Behavior change communication
- Use of technology

**2. Poshan Maah (September):**
- Nutrition month celebration
- Intensive activities
- Community engagement

**3. Growth Monitoring:**
- Height measurement every 6 months
- Weight every month
- Plot on growth charts

**4. Technology Use:**
- Smartphone-based application
- Real-time monitoring
- Data-driven decision making

**AWW's Role:**
- Active participation in Poshan Maah
- Accurate growth monitoring
- Community mobilization
- Using technology for reporting

slides.title: Other Government Schemes - Part 1
slides.content:
**Schemes You Should Know**

**National Creche Scheme:**
- Day care for children 6 months-6 years
- For working mothers
- Operated by NGOs/private agencies
- 10 children minimum per creche
- Provides nutrition, care, and early learning

**Scheme for Adolescent Girls (SAG):**
- Earlier called Kishori Shakti Yojana
- For girls 11-18 years
- Not in school (out-of-school girls)
- Nutrition supplementation
- Life skills education
- Health checkups

**National Plan of Action for Children:**
- Framework for child rights
- Addresses survival, development, protection, participation
- Guides government policies

**Maternity Benefit Programme:**
- Covered earlier (PMMVY)
- Cash support for pregnant and lactating women

slides.title: Other Government Schemes - Part 2
slides.content:
**More Important Schemes**

**National Health Mission (NHM):**
- Umbrella program for health
- Includes NRHM and NUHM
- Focuses on maternal and child health
- Provides free healthcare

**Rashtriya Bal Swasthya Karyakram (RBSK):**
- Child health screening program
- Screens for 4 Ds:
  - Defects at birth
  - Deficiencies (nutrition)
  - Diseases in children
  - Development delays
- Early intervention and treatment

**Mission Indradhanush:**
- Intensified immunization program
- Focuses on unvaccinated/partially vaccinated children
- Covers 12 vaccine-preventable diseases
- Special drives in high-focus areas

**Swachh Bharat Abhiyan:**
- Clean India Mission
- Open defecation free (ODF)
- Toilet construction
- Behavior change for hygiene
- Important for child health

slides.title: Reporting and Documentation
slides.content:
**Important Registers and Records**

**Registers to Maintain:**

**1. Beneficiary Register:**
- List of all enrolled children (0-6 years)
- Pregnant and lactating women
- Personal details

**2. Attendance Register:**
- Daily attendance of children
- Preschool activities attendance

**3. Stock Register:**
- Food grains received
- Daily consumption
- Balance stock

**4. Growth Monitoring Register:**
- Monthly weight
- Height (every 6 months)
- Nutritional status

**5. Immunization Tracking Register:**
- Vaccination status
- Due dates
- Follow-up

**6. Home Visit Register:**
- Date and purpose of visit
- Observations
- Counseling provided

**Monthly Reporting:**
- Monthly progress report (MPR)
- Submit to supervisor
- Includes all activities and achievements

slides.title: Community Participation
slides.content:
**Engaging the Community**

**Village Health Sanitation and Nutrition Committee (VHSNC):**
- Community-level committee
- Plans and monitors health and nutrition activities
- AWW is a member
- Monthly meetings

**Mothers' Meetings:**
- Conduct monthly
- Discuss child care practices
- Demonstrate cooking methods
- Share experiences
- Build community support

**Village Health and Nutrition Day (VHND):**
- Monthly event
- ANM visits village
- Immunization session
- Antenatal checkups
- Health education
- AWW plays key coordination role

**Gram Sabha:**
- Village assembly
- AWW presents Anganwadi activities
- Seeks community support
- Discusses issues

**Community Mobilization:**
- Create awareness about ICDS services
- Encourage participation
- Address myths and misconceptions
- Build trust with community

question.questionText: How many services are provided under the Integrated Child Development Services (ICDS) program?
question.explanation: ICDS provides 6 services: (1) Supplementary Nutrition, (2) Immunization, (3) Health Check-ups, (4) Referral Services, (5) Preschool Education, and (6) Nutrition and Health Education.
